Bar chart data

Source: R/rfm-plots-data.R
rfm_barchart_data.Rd

Data for generating bar charts.

rfm_barchart_data(rfm_table)

Arguments

rfm_table

An object of class rfm_table.

Examples

# using transaction data
analysis_date <- as.Date('2006-12-31')
rfm_order <- rfm_table_order(rfm_data_orders, customer_id, order_date,
revenue, analysis_date)

# bar chart data
rfm_barchart_data(rfm_order)
#> # A tibble: 995 x 9
#>    customer_id        date_most_recent recency_days transaction_count amount
#>    <chr>              <date>                  <dbl>             <dbl>  <dbl>
#>  1 Abbey O'Reilly DVM 2006-06-09                205                 6    472
#>  2 Add Senger         2006-08-13                140                 3    340
#>  3 Aden Lesch Sr.     2006-06-20                194                 4    405
#>  4 Admiral Senger     2006-08-21                132                 5    448
#>  5 Agness O'Keefe     2006-10-02                 90                 9    843
#>  6 Aileen Barton      2006-10-08                 84                 9    763
#>  7 Ailene Hermann     2006-03-25                281                 8    699
#>  8 Aiyanna Bruen PhD  2006-04-29                246                 4    157
#>  9 Ala Schmidt DDS    2006-01-16                349                 3    363
#> 10 Alannah Borer      2005-04-21                619                 4    196
#> # ... with 985 more rows, and 4 more variables: recency_score <fct>,
#> #   frequency_score <int>, monetary_score <int>, rfm_score <dbl>

# using customer data
analysis_date <- as.Date('2007-01-01')
rfm_customer <- rfm_table_customer(rfm_data_customer, customer_id,
number_of_orders, recency_days, revenue, analysis_date)

# bar chart data
rfm_barchart_data(rfm_customer)
#> # A tibble: 39,999 x 8
#>    customer_id recency_days transaction_count amount recency_score
#>          <dbl>        <dbl>             <dbl>  <dbl> <fct>        
#>  1       22086          232                 9    777 2            
#>  2        2290          115                16   1555 4            
#>  3       26377           43                 5    336 5            
#>  4       24650           64                12   1189 5            
#>  5       12883           23                12   1229 5            
#>  6        2119           72                11    929 5            
#>  7       31283          112                17   1569 4            
#>  8       33815          142                11    778 3            
#>  9       15972           43                 9    641 5            
#> 10       27650          131                10    970 3            
#> # ... with 39,989 more rows, and 3 more variables: frequency_score <int>,
#> #   monetary_score <int>, rfm_score <dbl>
